snippet: Guan Tianlang of China, the reigning champion of a competition conceived by Augusta National in 2008 to develop amateur golfers, will bring his budding game there for the Masters this week.
abstract: Guan Tianlang of China, at 14 years old, will be youngest participant ever at Masters golf tournament.

byline.contributor: Dan Levin contributed reporting from China.

lead_paragraph: Guan Tianlang of China, the reigning champion of a competition conceived by Augusta National in 2008 to develop amateur golfers, will bring his budding game there for the Masters this week.

headline.seo: Masters — Guan Tianlang, at 14, Embodies Augusta’s Vision for Growing Golf
headline.main: 14-Year-Old Embodies Augusta’s Vision for Growing Golf
headline.print_headline: At 14, an Embodiment of Augusta’s Vision, and an Entrant
